page.title: Domestic responses to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

rev.comment: /* Mohammed ElBaradei */ That part was a rumor that was later denied by all parties...I Know, I added it
rev.diff:
Line 230: Line 230:
ElBaradei has also stated that "the people (of Egypt) want the regime to fall". In response to the appointment of [[Omar Suleiman]] as the new Vice President of Egypt, ElBaradei stated that it was a "hopeless, desperate attempt by Mubarak to stay in power, I think it is loud and clear...that Mubarak has to leave today". Additionally, ElBaradei restated the position that when Egypt does become a democratic nation and that "there is no reason to believe that a democracy in Egypt would not lead to a better relationship with the US based on respect and equity."<ref>[[Fareed Zakaria|Zakaria, Fareed]] (30 January 2011). [http://www.cnn.com/video/#/video/bestoftv/2011/01/30/gps.elbaradei.intv.cnn?iref=allsearch "ElBaradei: Egypt's Mubarak Must Leave"] (video; requires [[Adobe Flash]]). ''[[Fareed Zakaria GPS]]'' (via ''[[CNN]]''). Retrieved 1 February 2011.</ref>
ElBaradei has also stated that "the people (of Egypt) want the regime to fall". In response to the appointment of [[Omar Suleiman]] as the new Vice President of Egypt, ElBaradei stated that it was a "hopeless, desperate attempt by Mubarak to stay in power, I think it is loud and clear...that Mubarak has to leave today". Additionally, ElBaradei restated the position that when Egypt does become a democratic nation and that "there is no reason to believe that a democracy in Egypt would not lead to a better relationship with the US based on respect and equity."<ref>[[Fareed Zakaria|Zakaria, Fareed]] (30 January 2011). [http://www.cnn.com/video/#/video/bestoftv/2011/01/30/gps.elbaradei.intv.cnn?iref=allsearch "ElBaradei: Egypt's Mubarak Must Leave"] (video; requires [[Adobe Flash]]). ''[[Fareed Zakaria GPS]]'' (via ''[[CNN]]''). Retrieved 1 February 2011.</ref>
â
April 6 Youth Movement, We are all Khaled Said Movement, [[National Association for Change]], Jan 25 Movement and [[Kefaya]] ''(The main organizers of the protests)'' have asked Mohammed ElBaradei to act in the country's internal affairs and foreign affairs in the transitional phase, and the formation of a temporarily national salvation government on the 30th of January.<ref>{{Clarify|date=February 2011|reason=at minimum, needs english translation of arabic headline appended next to arabic headline.}} {{Cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/arabic/middleeast/2011/01/110130_egypt_demo_new.shtml|title=Ø§ÙØ¬ÙØ´ ÙØ¯ÙØ¹ Ø¨ØªØ¹Ø²ÙØ²Ø§Øª Ø§Ø¶Ø§ÙÙØ© ÙØ·Ø§Ø¦Ø±Ø§Øª Ø­Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ØªØ­ÙÙ ÙÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØªØ¸Ø§ÙØ±ÙÙ ÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØ§ÙØ±Ø©|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|work=[[BBC Arabic]]|date=30 January 2011|accessdate=30 January 2011}}</ref> Later that day, He formed a steering committee. The committee is composed of Mohammed ElBaradei, Ayman Nour, {{link-interwiki|en=Magdy Ahmed Hussain|en_text=Magdy Ahmed Hussain|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ¬Ø¯Ù Ø£Ø­ÙØ¯ Ø­Ø³ÙÙ}}, {{link-interwiki|en=Mohammed Beltagui|en_text=Mohammed Beltagui|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ­ÙØ¯ Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØªØ§Ø¬Ù}}, Abdul Jalil Mustafa, {{link-interwiki|en=Abdel Halim Kandil|en_text=Abdel Halim Kandil|lang=ar|lang_title=Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§ÙØ­ÙÙÙ ÙÙØ¯ÙÙ}}, {{link-interwiki|en=Osama Al Ghazali Harb|en_text=Osama Al Ghazali Harb|lang=ar|lang_title=Ø£Ø³Ø§ÙØ© Ø§ÙØºØ²Ø§ÙÙ Ø­Ø±Ø¨}}, {{link-interwiki|en=George Isaac|en_text=George Isaac|lang=ar|lang_title=Ø¬ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø¥Ø³Ø­Ø§Ù}}, {{link-interwiki|en=Hamdeen Sabah|en_text=Hamdeen Sabah|lang=ar|lang_title=Ø­ÙØ¯ÙÙ ØµØ¨Ø§Ø­Ù}} and a youth from the leaders of the demonstrators.<ref>{{Clarify|date=February 2011|reason=at minimum, needs english translation of arabic headline appended next to arabic headline.}} {{Cite news|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/A5D9789E-24E2-4A8F-B8E5-CC585AF34A23.htm|title=ÙØ¬ÙØ© ÙØ·ÙÙØ© ÙÙÙØ§ÙØ¶Ø© ÙØ¸Ø§Ù ÙØ¨Ø§Ø±Ù|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|date=30 January 2011|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
+
April 6 Youth Movement, We are all Khaled Said Movement, [[National Association for Change]], Jan 25 Movement and [[Kefaya]] ''(The main organizers of the protests)'' have asked Mohammed ElBaradei to act in the country's internal affairs and foreign affairs in the transitional phase, and the formation of a temporarily national salvation government on the 30th of January.<ref>{{Clarify|date=February 2011|reason=at minimum, needs english translation of arabic headline appended next to arabic headline.}} {{Cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/arabic/middleeast/2011/01/110130_egypt_demo_new.shtml|title=Ø§ÙØ¬ÙØ´ ÙØ¯ÙØ¹ Ø¨ØªØ¹Ø²ÙØ²Ø§Øª Ø§Ø¶Ø§ÙÙØ© ÙØ·Ø§Ø¦Ø±Ø§Øª Ø­Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ØªØ­ÙÙ ÙÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØªØ¸Ø§ÙØ±ÙÙ ÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØ§ÙØ±Ø©|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|work=[[BBC Arabic]]|date=30 January 2011|accessdate=30 January 2011}}</ref>
